text: Let me know if you would like help <@U0K8ZSHN0> :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0B9N0HF0> - can you coordinate a plan w/ <@U0K8ZSHN0> and <@U1HKQRLMR> on this?
Sorry late arrival. Yes I can!
<@U0K8ZSHN0> <@U1HKQRLMR> Have either of you written a grant proposal before?
nope
there is a whole category of career that is proposal grant writing
:slightly_smiling_face:
haha, yeah I know. Trying to get a gauge of how high the hill is :slightly_smiling_face:
The hill is not phd grant high
I have but it was years ago and I was working with people who had before. I am sure I can find some resources though if we need them.

Ok great! Well, first step is we should probably gauge if we meet the programs intellectual merit and commercial impact criteria. In order to do that: "You can communicate with Program Director Rick Schwerdtfeger (<mailto:caschwer@nsf.gov|caschwer@nsf.gov>) to gauge if a project meets the program's intellectual merit and commercial impact criteria. Email a 1-2 page executive summary discussing the following aspects of the project: 1) the company and team 2) the market opportunity, value proposition, and customers 3) the technology/innovation 4) the competition. Please note that responsiveness will likely be limited in the 2 weeks leading up to the solicitation deadline.”
I’ll set up some time between us to discuss strategy and approach to how we want to position Sommely
Awesome.
<@U026NB2U2> Do we want to be in that meeting?
Make me optional.
I'll take a look at the output.
My schedule over the next two weeks is awful.
Cool
<http://www.networkworld.com/article/3029253/internet-of-things/how-sigfox-plans-to-spread-its-low-power-iot-network-across-the-u-s.html>

attachments.title: How Sigfox plans to spread its low-power IoT network across the U.S.
attachments.text: French IoT network company Sigfox plans to expand to 10 U.S. cities in the first quarter of 2016 alone. Here's how they plan to get it done.
attachments.fallback: Network World: How Sigfox plans to spread its low-power IoT network across the U.S.

text: ^ this is not something I knew about
there are a lot more microcontroller options than i had previously thought
we are still in the $2.5-$3 per mcu range but we all know what happens every 18 months
